member.summary: A rectangle, expressed in points with the origin at the bottom left corner, defining the visible region of default user space. When the page is displayed or printed, its contents are to be clipped (cropped) to this rectangle and then imposed on the output medium in some implementation-defined manner.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Page.ArtBox

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.TextShape.Bold
member.summary: If set, the text appears bold. Note that the boldness is simulated by using a thicker stroke. It is preferrable to use a bold font if possible. E.g. use arialbd.ttf for bold Arial and arial.ttf for regular Arial. This property is ignored if applied to a Bold font.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.TextShape.Italic
member.summary: If set, the text appears italic. Note that the italicness is simulated by skewing the text slightly. It is preferrable to use an italic font if possible. E.g. use ariali.ttf for italic Arial and arial.ttf for regular Arial. This property is ignored if applied to an Italic font.

member.summary: Do not change the blend mode, but interit it from it's container.

member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color, then complements the result. Note: Screening any color with white results in white; screening with black leaved the original color unchanged.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. Note: Paiting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produce no change.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color (see difference, but with lowel contrast). Note: Paiting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produce no change.

member.summary: The effective height (in points) of the barcode given the current settings.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay
member.summary: Different ways to specifiy how the page is displayed in the viewer.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.PositionZoom
member.summary:
The page is displayed with specified zoom and specified position.
The top and left positions and the zoom are specified by the Top, Left and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination.
The Right and Bottom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitEntire
member.summary: Fit the entire page both horizontally and vertically.
member.para: The Left, Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitHorizontally
member.summary:
Fit the page horizontally.
The top position is specified by the Top property of ExplicitDestination.
The Left, Right, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitVertically
member.summary:
Fit the page vertically.
The left position is specified by the Left property of ExplicitDestination.
The Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitRectangle
member.summary:
Fit the specified rectangle.
The rectangle is specified by the Left, Right, Top and Bottom properties of ExplicitDestination.
The Zoom property of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitBoundingBox
member.summary:
Fit the bounding box of the page contents both horizontally and vertically.
The Left, Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitBoundingBoxHorizontally
member.summary:
Fit the bounding box of the page contents horizontally.
The top position is specified by the Top property of ExplicitDestination.
The Left, Right, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Navigation.PageDisplay.FitBoundingBoxVertically
member.summary:
Fit the bounding box of the page contents vertically.
The left position is specified by the Left property of ExplicitDestination.
The Right, Top, Bottom and Zoom properties of ExplicitDestination may not be set.

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.DocumentWriteMode
member.summary: Different document write modes.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.DocumentWriteMode.Compact
member.summary:
Instead of appending an update only, the document is completely rewitten.
Note that existing signed signature fields will be invalidated.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.DocumentWriteMode.AppendUpdate
member.summary:
Only an update is appended to this existing document.
A new document will be written in Compact mode since this will be the first update. Existing document will be forced to append changes only.
Supported features:
Changes in Metadata.
Changes in DocumentInfo.
Removing, adding or moving Pages.
Adding Shapes to pages.
Changes in Actions (except the Bookmark actions).
Changes in NamedDestinations.
Changes in document level JavaScripts.
Changes in Widgets.
Changes in Fields (including signing an additional signature field, see signature field for details).
Changes in Bookmarks.
Changes in ViewerPreferences.
Note: You should not change the Security, otherwise an incorrect document will be written.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.DocumentWriteMode.Auto
member.summary:
The document is writen eighter Full or AppendUpdate, depending if a signed signature is already embedded in the document or the document is marked that it allows to have updates only.
New document will be written in Compact mode. Existing document will be written in Full mode if possible, otherwise AppendUpdate mode will be used.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.TextExtraction.ClipVisibility.Fully
member.summary: This glyph is fully clipped, so nothing will be visible.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.TextExtraction.ClipVisibility.Partially
member.summary: This glyph is partially clipped, so some content can be visible (depending on the pen and brush, e.g. if both are null this is transparent content).

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.TextExtraction.ClipVisibility.None
member.summary: This glyph is not clipped, so all content can be visible (depending on the pen and brush, e.g. if both are null this is transparent content).

member.name: T:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights
member.summary: Font licensing rights.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.Unknown
member.summary: The font licensing rights could not be determined.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.InstallableEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may be embedded and permanently installed on the remote system by an application. The user of the remote system acquires the identical rights, obligations and licenses for that font as the original purchaser of the font, and is subject to the same end-user license agreement, copyright, design patent, and/or trademark as was the original purchaser.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.RestrictedLicenseEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font must not be modified, embedded or exchanged in any manner without first obtaining permission of the legal owner. Caution: For Restricted License embedding to take effect, it must be the only level of embedding selected.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.PreviewAndPrintEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may be embedded, and temporarily loaded on the remote system. Documents containing Preview & Print fonts must be opened "read-only;" no edits can be applied to the document.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.EditableEmbedding
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may be embedded but must only be installed temporarily on other systems. In contrast to Preview & Print fonts, documents containing Editable fonts may be opened for reading, editing is permitted, and changes may be saved.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.NoSubsetting
member.summary: This setting indicates that the font may not be subsetted prior to embedding. Other embedding restrictions may also apply.

member.name: F:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.FontLicensingRights.BitmapEmbeddingOnly
member.summary: This setting indicates that only bitmaps contained in the font may be embedded. No outline data may be embedded. If there are no bitmaps available in the font, then the font is considered unembeddable and the embedding services will fail. Other embedding restrictions may also apply.

member.name: M:TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.PageShape.#ctor(TallComponents.PDF.Page,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,TallComponents.PDF.Shapes.PageBoundary)
member.summary: Create a new page shape.
member.param: The existing page that will be rendered inside this page shape.
The horizontal position of the left edge of this page shape.
The vertical position of the bottom edge of this page shape.
The width of this page shape.
The height of this page shape.
The width/height ratio is equal to the ratio of the original page.
The rotation the page shape clockwise (360 corresponds to a full circle).

This shape has the contents from the specified page boundary. If the page does not have the specified page boundary, then it will be automatically using the following fallback: ArtBox --> CropBox; TrimBox --> CropBox; BleedBox --> CropBox; CropBox --> MediaBox.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.Font.BaselineOffset
member.summary: The distance in points between the lower extreme of a font and the visual baseline for a font of size 1 pt. Multiply the value of this property with the font size to get the distance in points.

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.Font.UnderlineOffset

member.name: P:TallComponents.PDF.Fonts.Font.StrikeOutOffset
